description.narrative: Founded in 2003, Anima Educação (Anima or the Company), an existing IFC strategic client, is a quality-focused listed for-profit tertiary education company in Brazil, offering undergraduate, graduate, technical courses and online executive courses. With 115k students, the Company ranks #8 by number of students and operates a total of 43 campuses in the states of Minas Gerais, São Paulo, Santa Catarina, Paraná and Goiás through its brands UNA, UNI-BH, USJT, SOCIESC and Le Cordon Bleu (through a joint venture). In addition, Anima provides corporate training through its brand HSM and EBRADI. Its value proposition is an affordable superior academic quality offer, a strong corporate identity based on innovation, personalized contents and career path powered by a unique learning system. Anima just announced the acquisition of AGES, a 5,6K top quality university group with 7 campuses in the states of Bahia and Sergipe (frontier regions), with a relevant positioning in medical courses. The investment project with IFC intends to support the acquisition of AGES and the Companys expansion plans.

The Project is expected to have a positive development impact by (i) increasing access to high quality affordable tertiary education in a frontier region in Brazil, (ii) contributing to address the shortage of physicians and nurses in the Northeastern region of Brazil given AGES' focus on health disciplines, and (iii) contributing to market competitiveness through demonstration of an effective business model that enables smaller tertiary education providers to formalize their operations, scale up, reach efficient costs and expand their services in underserved areas.
